fetch:
• Copy Program Counter into MAR on the next line in Your Simulation
  • Go to Physical Location (RAM address} which matches the MAR) in 'Your Program'
  • Copy Data on the poster, in to MDR
decode:
• Look up the Instruction in the Instruction Set for the MDR (Data)
  • Write it in the Decoded column.
execute:
• Do the Decoded maths to your current Accumulator.
  • Copy the result in to the ACC column.
  • Add 1 to the Program Counter

fetch:
• Copy Program Counter into MAR on the next line in Your Simulation
  • Go to Physical Location (RAM address} which matches the MAR) in 'Your Program'
  • Copy Data on the poster, in to MDR
decode:
• Look up the Instruction in the Instruction Set for the MDR (Data)
  • Either it is an Operation or an Operand (number to to the operation with.
  • Write it in the Decoded column.
execute:
• If you have decoded an Operation keep it until you decode an operand
  • Do the Decoded math to your current Accumulator.
  • Copy the result in to the ACC column.
  • Add 1 to the Program Counter

fetch:
• Copy Program Counter into MAR on the next line in Your Simulation
  • Go to Physical Location (RAM address} which matches the MAR) in 'Your Program'
  • Copy Data on the poster, in to MDR
decode:
• Look up the Instruction in the Instruction Set for the MDR (Data)
  • Either it is an Operation or an Operand depending what you expect next, (start with an operation).
  • Write it in the Operation or Operand column.
execute:
• If you have decoded an Operation that takes an operand, keep it until you decode an Operand
  • Then perform that calculation to Accumulator and copy the result in to the ACC column.
  • Add 1 to the Program Counter

fetch:
• Copy Program Counter into MAR on the next line in Your Simulation
  • Go to Physical Location (RAM address} which matches the MAR) in 'Your Program'
  • Copy Data on the poster, in to MDR
decode:
• Look up the Instruction in the Instruction Set for the MDR (Data)
  • Either it is an Operation or an Operand depending what you expect next, (start with an operation).
  • Write it in the Operation or Operand column.
execute:
• If you have decoded an Operation that takes an operand, keep it until you decode an Operand
  • Then perform that calculation to Accumulator and copy the result in to the ACC column.
  • If the Operation is JMP copy the Operand into Program Counter
  • Else add 1 to the Program Counter
